intro: Dryandra subulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
